I guess if you are not used to the "correct" way to order it annoys him. Needless to say once I realized he was being a bit of a smart a** with me, he must have seen my facial expression change because he then tried to clean it up with a small joke. I could tell that even the cook noticed that I was bothered because he kept looking our way and was overly nice when he started to make my order. I'm not sure if I'll come back here but I definitely hope the next customer is treated better.

I would recommend this place to anyone! My wife, kids, and I went there today. The food was great and the staff were extremely hospitable. The Chilli burger was really good! I will definitely be back!

I was happy to see another burger place filled the space of the old Burger Company which did not last long here.  

Chubz focus is a bit different than its predecessor in that it sells affordable burgers, dogs and fries and the theme is chili!  

I stopped in here and the place was kind of dead.  One table was occupied, a few people working behind the counter.  You'd think I'd be waiting on right away but I waited about 10 minutes before someone took my order.  The car at the drive thru pulled up after I was standing there for 5 minutes an they waited on them first.  So I was getting a bit impatient.  The someone finally waited on me and the person working the drive-thru was having register issues and the person taking my order was interrupted by that. So 15 minutes later, my order was complete.  Fast Food this is not!

Anyway, I ordered the #1 combo which is a chili cheeseburger, fries and drink to go.   It wasn't too long to prepare.  Everything smelled wonderful. Unfortunately, taste wise, I was a bit disappointed.  Besides chili, there was another theme to this meal....Salt...and lots of it.  Everything was salty..the burger, the chili and the fries.  The fries were almost unedible due to the amount of salt on them.  They were fresh cut with an extra salty chili seasoning.  The burger was the right size and covered with chili.  The standard toppings for the burger include mustard, tomato, onions and pickles which is a nice combination.

I like the concept, the prices are good but I believe they need to improve their service and cut back on the salt for this place to survive.
Best chili cheese burgers I've had since I moved here..... Reminds me of back home.....

Now to describe CHUBZ as out of the way is not accurate as it's in Charlotte with a Woodlawn Rd address but I can describe it as interesting to get too, at least in terms of how the Google Maps lady took me.  What's also interesting and may throw the less adventurous off is that it's in a strip mall that also includes a strip club and a "toy store".  Think adult, not Toyz R Us.  My advice would be to NOT let this throw you and go ahead in and get some food (they also have online ordering and a drive thru window if you want to go that route along with delivery w/in 5 miles for a $2 fee).

They have a number of tables and a counter where you can sit facing the grills and the dudes at work taking your order and cooking your food.  I went on a Saturday around lunchtime and it was a two dude operation. They were friendly and having fun with each other as they worked as well as with customers who were clearly regulars.  It felt like there was a pretty decent stream of folks coming in to eat, pick up to-go orders and going through the drive thru.

I chose to dine in at the counter and went with the #1 Double Chili-cheeseburger combo subbing onion rings for french fries.  I got the burger all the way minus tomato and that meant their homegrown chili and American cheese along with pickles, onions and mustard.  While the chili was good I'd say it was not the best I've ever had on a burger and the patties themselves were yummy thin Smashburger types.  All in all I enjoyed the burger and look forward to having one of the others that include their CHUBZ sauce (Not sure what it is but want to find out!).  The onion rings were battered vs. breaded and tasty/crunchy though this batch was definitely on the greasy side.

I left FULL and happy and can't really imagine what I'd do if I ever ordered a triple burger or their half pound variety.  They also have dogs and a few other things like ribeye steak and cheesesteak sandwiches.  Arnold said it best.... I'll be back.
Unprofessional they never answer the phone and they leave early closing as earlier 45 mins. Very disappointed in them I was a regular customer
